title: Haiti Earthquake
description: A devastating 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck Haiti, causing catastrophic damage to Port-au-Prince and surrounding areas
highlights: Cause: Rupture of the Enriquillo-Plantain Garden fault system
Result: Over 230,000 deaths, 300,000 injured, 1.5 million displaced
Significance: One of deadliest earthquakes in recorded history, prompted massive international humanitarian response
Fun fact: The earthquake was felt in Cuba, Jamaica, and Venezuela, over 200 miles away

title: Russian Heat Wave & Wildfires
description: Record-breaking heat wave with temperatures reaching 44°C (111°F), triggering massive wildfires across western Russia
highlights: Cause: Unusual blocking high-pressure system causing prolonged extreme heat
Result: Over 56,000 deaths, $15 billion in economic losses, destroyed crops
Significance: Moscow experienced hottest summer in 1,000 years, smoke from fires blanketed the capital
Highlighted fact: ISS astronauts could see the smoke plumes from space covering an area larger than California

title: Tōhoku Earthquake & Tsunami
description: Magnitude 9.1 earthquake triggered devastating tsunami waves up to 40 meters high, leading to Fukushima nuclear disaster
highlights: Cause: Massive thrust fault rupture along Japan Trench subduction zone
Result: Nearly 20,000 deaths, Fukushima Daiichi nuclear meltdown, $235 billion in damages
Significance: Fourth most powerful earthquake ever recorded globally, shifted Earth's axis by 10-25 cm
Fun fact: The tsunami traveled across the Pacific Ocean, causing damage as far as California and Chile
Highlighted fact: ISS captured images of the coastline before and after, showing the massive scale of destruction

title: Arab Spring Begins
description: Pro-democracy uprisings spread across the Middle East and North Africa, starting with Tunisia's Jasmine Revolution
highlights: Cause: Widespread dissatisfaction with authoritarian regimes, economic hardship, corruption, and lack of freedoms
Result: Governments overthrown in Tunisia, Egypt, Libya, and Yemen; civil wars in Syria and Libya
Significance: Largest revolutionary wave in the Arab world since 1945, reshaped regional politics
Fun fact: Social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter played crucial role in organizing protests
Highlighted fact: The movement started when Tunisian street vendor Mohamed Bouazizi set himself on fire in protest
